intro: Chelone glabra subsp. dilatata, commonly known as white hellebore, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It features showy, bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has smooth, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ecologically valuable member of the Ranunculaceae family.
